reviewText:
23/10/15 Update: The game runs with a fresh install now, although it still requires an extra gamemaker install before playing, and doesn't run as a steam program.
It took the developer almost 2 months to even attempt to fix this issue and he only seemed motivated after he was shamed on reddit.

Completely broken. The game has been on steam since the 31st of August yet has no reviews or screenshots. It seems the game won't run on any Windows system due to the period at the end of the games folder in the steam directory. I had to run it in SAM to get the minimum playtime required to write a review.
voteText: 25 of 28 people (89%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
First of all, this game have technical issue which it cannot run in any windows OS since the developer made the folder name with ." in it. You can read about it here: http://steamcommunity.com/app/365930/discussions/0/487870763296052311/
Since 23 October 2015 Update. it now can run in windows but still need to workaround before you can fully enjoy the game.
Guide for it here: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=540154895

Techinal issue aside
date:
I could say that this game is pretty darn good.
You only play with arrow keys in this game and your mission is get to the end point of each level.
There are 60 normal levels to finish plus some bonus level.
"
helpfulPercent: 11 of 12 people (92%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
First impression: cheap timing game.

It's all about avoiding moving objects. Well, it would be if it wasn't also dealing with annoying scrolling backgrounds (seizure danger?), an avatar moving just fast enough to run into any bot you're following and die, and the angular avatar means that turning a corner is a bit like threading a needle.

There's no way to exit the game, partial controller support" means keyboard only (as far as I can tell)
date: the "play" button on Steam always runs the installer
recommended: and the game's native resolution is 965*620 or thereabouts.\n\nNot my cup of tea
voteText: I'd probably think it slightly overpriced."
votesFunny: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Crashes Steam if you happen to press the play button.

Workaround: go to the game's folder, extract STOORM-Game.exe with your favorite archiver (it is actually a self-contained archive) and launch the game from the resulting directory.
If you want to be able to launch it in Steam, you have to move files back in the original directory and rename STOORM.exe to STOORM-Game.exe .
The game itself is an utterly basic action game. Nothing to write about.

Edit: Actually the only positive review already mentions all of this, oops!
voteText: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText: First, click start" to open  the game installer;\nSecond
date: choose the address where Steam download this game for install;\nThird
recommended:
replace the new exe's name "STOORM'' with installer's name "STOORM-Game".
Now it can be played. With Steam.

But still have many bugs..."

reviewText:
Worth 2â‚¬, not 4.

Had no tehcnical issues with the game as mentionned by the other reviews, they're probably fixed by now.

However, i don't think this is a good game. It looks lke it's something made during a gamejam.
The gameplay is very basic,  nothing original although it's done properly.

Worst point is probably the music. It's just horrible and you get quickly sick of it.

You probably won't get hooked by the game enough to finish all the levels and will give up out of boreness at the first  difficult level. For me, it was level 74. Whoever designed this level is a sadist ;)
